Xanathar.description: A beholder crime lord who rules the Waterdeep's criminal underworld.
Xanathar.appearance: A large, floating orb with a single, large eye and ten smaller eyes on stalks.
Xanathar.personality: Paranoid, delusional, and megalomaniacal. He is obsessed with his own legend and is constantly seeking to expand his influence. Despite his paranoia, he is a master manipulator and is able to maintain a network of spies and informants throughout Waterdeep. His greatest weakness is his irrational love of his pet fish, Sylgar.
Xanathar.goals: Xanathar seeks to expand his influence and eliminate his rivals. He is willing to do whatever it takes to achieve his goals, including killing innocents.

Thalia Greenleaf.description: A human bard who works in a tavern at the docks called the Sea Sprite. She is a skilled musician and storyteller, and is known for her quick wit and sharp tongue. She is also a member of the Harpers, a secret organization dedicated to fighting evil and promoting justice. She is a potential party member.
Thalia Greenleaf.appearance: A young human woman with long, curly brown hair and bright green eyes. She is usually dressed in colorful, flowing clothes and carries a lute.
Thalia Greenleaf.personality: Thalia is outgoing and friendly, but she is also fiercely independent and has a strong sense of justice. She is quick to make friends, but she is also quick to anger when she sees injustice.
Thalia Greenleaf.goals: Thalia is dedicated to the cause of the Harpers, and is always looking for ways to help those in need and fight against evil. She is also a talented musician and storyteller, and is always looking for new material for her performances.

Volothamp Geddarm.description: A famous author and wizard who is known for his books on the subject of monsters and dungeons.  He is fairly useless in a fight.
Volothamp Geddarm.appearance: A middle-aged gnome with a floppy hat and glasses. He is usually dressed in colorful, flowing clothes and carries a satchel full of books and scrolls.
Volothamp Geddarm.personality: He has an inflated ego, a tendency to exaggerate or even fabricate his exploits, and poor financial sense, but has his charms, and is always looking for the next big story. He will always help a friend in need.
Volothamp Geddarm.goals: Volo is always looking for new material for his books.

Jarlaxle Baenre.description: A drow rogue and leader of the mercenary group Bregan D'aerthe. He is a potential ally or enemy, depending on the party's actions. He infiltrated the lawless city of Luskan and declared himself its secret lord.
Jarlaxle Baenre.appearance: A drow with long, white hair and a well-groomed beard. He is usually dressed flayboyantly in fine clothes and carries a number of magical items.
Jarlaxle Baenre.personality: He is clever, with a sharp sense of humor, and a knack for creating a tangled web of scemes that leave his enemies baffled. He admires boldness in his allies and his enemies alike, and while dangerous and unpredictable, has a sense of thieves' honor and gamesmanship.
Jarlaxle Baenre.goals: He is determined to find a way to force the Lord's Alliance to admit Luskan as a member, by hook or by crook.

Manshoon.description: An ancient archwizard who was believed to have been killed long ago, but lives on in secret. Leader of the Zhentarim. He is a potential ally, depending on the party's actions.
Manshoon.personality: Evil to his core, he is ruthless and ambitious, and is willing to do whatever it takes to achieve his goals. He is also a master manipulator and is able to maintain a network of spies and informants throughout Faerun.
Manshoon.goals: Manshoon's goal is nothing less that the conquest of the entire Sword Coast. He aims to out Laeral Silverhand and take her place as Open Lord, kill the Blackstaff, and declare himself Wizard-King of Waterdeep.

setting.name: Waterdeep
setting.description: A bustling metropolis on the Sword Coast. The city is a hub of trade and commerce, and is home to a diverse population of humans, dwarves, elves, and many others. Waterdeep is ruled by a council of masked lords, who are advised by the open lord, Laeral Silverhand. The city is also home to a number of powerful criminal organizations, including the Xanathar Guild, the Zhentarim, and the Cassalanters.

The Field Ward.description: Newly built and though not an official ward of the city - the Watch doesn't patrol this area -, Field Ward is home to folk of all walks of life who lacked coin enough to hire lodgings or own buildings in old Waterdeep. It is a slum in some places, and a struggling middle-class area in others. The Ward is a noisy, lively area that's home to poor elves, half-bloods of all sorts, and dwarves who are determined to get the respect they are sure they deserve.

The Sea Ward.description: Waterdeep's wealthiest ward is notable for the many-spired, grand homes of the nobility, the gleaming edifices of the city's leading temples, and the imposing towers of the city's premier wizards.

The North Ward.description: Waterdeep's quietest ward is also one of its wealthiest. North Ward is home to most of the middle class and lesser noble families. This ward has few notable landmarks other than the Cliff watch, and it all but shuts down at dusk.

The Castle Ward.description: Castle Ward lies in the heart of Waterdeep, wrapping around the eastern slopes of Mount Waterdeep. This ward is home to Castle Waterdeep, Piergeiron's Palace and many city's administrative buildings. Ward of wealthy or influential people who can't count themselves among the nobility.

The Trades Ward.description: Given over almost entirely to commerce, Trades Ward lacks the feeling of community found in the more residential wards, but retains the hustle and bustle of a marketplace throughout the day and night.

The City of the Dead.description: This huge walled enclosure on the eastern edge of Trades Ward is the general cemetery for the City of Splendors. Many citizens visit the City of the Dead's parklike green lawns and white marble tombs during the day, for it is one of the few places dominated by greenery that the citizens of Waterdeep can share within the city walls.

The Dock Ward.description: Waterdeep's most notorious and colorful ward is also the oldest. Traveler's tales portray it as a lawless, brawling place of drunks, smugglers, and roaming monsters, which is not all that far from the truth. The bustling harbor scene and its attendant activities dominate this ward. Businesses and warehouses that depend on the city's newly restored harbor are located here.

The South Ward.description: Southern Ward lies in the southeastern corner of Waterdeep. Caravan City, as this ward is sometimes known, is a homely, friendly, busy, and largely poor area of Waterdeep. Stables, warehouses, and shops related to overland trade dominate this ward.

The Undercliff.description: An unofficial ward of Waterdeep, it is a rural community beyond the River Gate and the North Gate, encompassing the entire area under the east cliff. It is home to a number of small farms and estates, and is a popular destination for those seeking to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.

Deepwater Harbor.description: A famously deep and well-protected harbor, Waterdeep's harbor is the busiest port on the Sword Coast. The harbor is home to a wide variety of ships, from small fishing boats to massive warships. The harbor is also home to a number of warehouses and shipyards, and is a popular destination for merchants and sailors from all over the world. It is inhabited by merfolk who keep the peace within their own aquatic city.

Mount Waterdeep.description: The mountain on and around which the city of Waterdeep is built. A rough, rocky mountain and stood some 210 meters above the sea level, to the west of the city. Beneath the mountain is the notorious Undermountain. The Peaktop Aerie, home of the Griffon Cavalry, is located on the mountain's peak.

The Undermountain.description: A vast, multi-level dungeon beneath the city of Waterdeep. The Undermountain is home to a wide variety of monsters, traps, and treasures, and is a popular destination for adventurers seeking fame and fortune.

Skullport.description: A lawless, subterranean city beneath Waterdeep. Skullport is home to a wide variety of criminals, monsters, and other unsavory characters, and is a popular destination for adventurers seeking to make a name for themselves.

Deepwater Isle.description: A fortified island on the south edge of Deepwater Harbor. It is the command center of the City Navy

Stormhaven Island.description: A small island located in the harbor of Waterdeep. The island is home to a number of warehouses and shipyards, and is a popular destination for merchants and sailors from all over the world. The island is also home to a number of powerful creatures, including the beholder crime lord Xanathar.

The Mud Flats.description: A large muddy beach located on the west coast of Waterdeep. It is predominantly used by fishermen. It is accessible only by boat or through the West Gate.

The North Trollwall.description: The old northern wall of Waterdeep, which now separates the affluent North Ward from the poorer Field Ward. It is around 2 km long and runs from the North Trolltower to the Farwatch Tower. Since the construction of the New North Wall, the Trollwall is within the boundaries of the city, but still serves as a defensive purpose.

The New North Wall.description: The new northern wall of Waterdeep, which defends the new Field Ward. It runs from the Troll Gate on the northernmost coast of Waterdeep to the Endshift Tower, about 3.5 km.

The East Trollwall.description: The eastern wall of Waterdeep, which runs along the top of the cliffs between Farwatch Tower to Endcliff Tower. It ends at the high point of the cliffs at the Cliffwatch.

The Cliffwatch.description: An unwalled segment of Waterdeep's boundary, protected instead by sheer cliffs. It runs along the eastern boundary of the North Ward, between the Endcliff Tower and the Watchway Tower.

The South Trollwall.description: The wall along the southeastern edge of Waterdeep, which runs from the Watchway Tower to the East Torchtower. It is about 3.5 km  long, and connects to the harbor seawall. It is pierced by the River Gate and the South Gate.

The Mount Wall.description: The wall that runs along the western edge of Waterdeep between Mount Waterdeep and the coast, from the Seaeyes Tower to the Harborwatch Tower, running mostly through rough and uninhabited terrain. It has no gates and is about 3 km long.

The West Trollwall.description: The western wall of Waterdeep, running from Seaeyes Tower to the Trolltower. It separates the Sea Ward from the Mud Flats, and is pierced by the little used West Gate.

Deepwater Wall.description: The seawall that protects the southern edge of Waterdeep's harbor. It runs fron Harborwatch Tower on the northeast edge of the harbor across Stormhaven Island to the East Torchtower on the southwest edge of the harbor. It is pierced by three large and heavily traveled sea gates.

The Zhentarim.description: A powerful criminal organization that operates throughout the Sword Coast. The Zhentarim are known for their ruthlessness and their willingness to do whatever it takes to achieve their goals. The Zhentarim are involved in a wide range of criminal activities, including smuggling, extortion, and assassination.

The Xanathar Guild.description: A powerful criminal organization that is led by the beholder crime lord Xanathar. The Xanathar Guild is known for its ruthlessness and its willingness to do whatever it takes to achieve its goals. The Xanathar Guild is involved in a wide range of criminal activities, including smuggling, extortion, and assassination.

Bregan D'aerthe.description: A group of drow mercenaries and sailors made up of dishonorable and much-derided castaways of destroyed drow houses. Almost all members are male, and they are led by Jarlaxle Baenre. They operate several legitimate businesses, including the Sea Maiden's Faire, which they use as fronts.

Emerald Enclave.description: A group of druids, rangers, and other nature-loving adventurers who seek to protect the natural world from the depredations of civilization. The Emerald Enclave is known for its network of agents and its willingness to work with anyone who shares their goals.

Force Grey.description: An elite force of adventurers and city guard members sworn to defend Waterdeep. To become part of the group, one must be a member of the Grey Hands. They are mobilized by the Open Lord of Waterdeep in times of crisis.

Harpers.description: A secret organization dedicated to fighting evil and promoting justice. The Harpers are a loose-knit group of adventurers, spies, and informants who work to protect the innocent and oppose tyranny. The Harpers are known for their network of agents and their willingness to work with anyone who shares their goals. Their chief adversary is the Zhentarim.

The Lords' Alliance.description: A coalition of rulers from cities and towns across Faerûn who band together for mutual defense and mutual trade, including Baldur's Gate, Mirabar, Mithral Hall, Neverwinter, and Silverymoon. The Alliance works to assist one another in times of need and to promote trade and commerce. The Alliance is known for its network of agents and its willingness to work with anyone who shares their goals.

The Order of the Gauntlet.description: A group of paladins, clerics, and other holy warriors who seek to protect the innocent and oppose evil, but especially welcome worshippers of Torm, Helm, or Tyr. The Order often recruits adventurers who they believe will further their goals of defeating evil before it finds a foothold.
locations: Any temple of Tyr, Helm, or Torm

The Yawning Portal.description: A famous tavern built around the entrance to the Undermountain. The tavern is known for its lively atmosphere and its famous well, which leads down into the depths of the Undermountain. The Yawning Portal is a popular destination for adventurers seeking to explore the Undermountain, and is also a favorite haunt of Waterdeep's criminal element.

The Sea Sprite.description: A popular tavern and inn located on the docks. The Sea Sprite is known for its lively atmosphere and its excellent seafood. The tavern is a favorite haunt of sailors and adventurers, and is also a popular meeting place for members of the Harpers.

The Skewered Dragon.description: A rough and tumble tavern located in the heart of the Dock Ward. It is known in many circles that the tavern is owned by the Zhenantarim, and is a popular meeting place for members of the organization.

Kolat Towers.description: A crumbling residence that was abandoned years ago by the wizards who built it. The edifice is surrounded by a magical barrier that has properties of a wall of force. It is secretly the home of Manshoon.

The City of the Dead.description: A sprawling cemetery that is home to the graves of most of Waterdeep's citizens. The City of the Dead is also home to a number of mausoleums and crypts, and is a popular destination for those seeking to commune with the dead or find some solitude.

Cassalanter Villa.description: A grand mansion that is home to the Cassalanter family, one of Waterdeep's most powerful noble families. The villa is known for its opulent furnishings and its beautiful gardens.

Xanathar's Lair.description: Home of the beholder crime lord Xanathar. Its location is a closely guarded secret known only to a select few. An ancient dungeon complex originally built by Netherese mages, it connects to the nearby town of Skullport via a secret tunnel, and has a secret and very well-hidden entrance called the Staircase of Eyes with a door in the sewers below the Castle Ward. Its rooms are 20 feet high and are filled with a variety of traps and monsters.

Mistshore.description: A dangerous and lawless area of the city that is home to a number of criminals and other unsavory characters. Mistshore is a popular destination for those seeking to avoid the watchful eye of the city guard, and is also a popular meeting place for members of the Xanathar Guild.

story.premise: The party of adventurers is hired by a wealthy noble in Waterdeep to investigate a series of mysterious disappearances in the city. The noble suspects a secretive cult operating in the shadows, and tasks the party with uncovering the truth behind the disappearances and putting an end to the cult's activities. The cult turns out to be the beholder crime lord Xanathar's guild, using the cult appearances to throw off the city watch and other factions in the city. The disappearances are part of a ritual to summon a powerful demon to the city as part of Xanathar's poorly-thought-out plan to take over the city. The party must stop the ritual before it's too late. In the final battle, the party must face off against an array of infernal creatures and the awakened giant walking statues that guard the city.
story.goal: The characters must uncover the Xanathar's plans and put a stop to them before it's too late. Along the way, they will have to navigate the complex web of alliances and rivalries that make up Waterdeep's criminal underworld, and deal with the various factions that have a stake in the city's future.
twists: The Xanathar is being manipulated by a powerful mind flayer who seeks to use the Xanathar's resources to further its own plans.
story.climax: The characters confront the Xanathar in his lair, deep within the Undermountain. They must defeat the Xanathar and put an end to his plans, while dealing with the mind flayer and its minions.

planned_sessions.title: Session 1: The Yawning Portal
planned_sessions.goal: The player is hired by an ally to investigate the activities of the Xanathar Guild. They will receive their first lead from an informant, Thalia Greenleaf. They may assemble a team with two other adventurers to help them in their quest.
planned_sessions.focus: Roleplaying, character introductions, investigation, and scene setting.

planned_sessions.title: Session 2: The Dock Ward
planned_sessions.goal: The player must gather information about the Xanathar Guild's activities in the Dock Ward and confront a member of the guild.
planned_sessions.combat_encounter: The player will face off against a group of Xanathar Guild thugs in a back alley.

planned_sessions.title: Session 3: The Field Ward
planned_sessions.goal: The player must track down a stolen artifact that has been taken by the Xanathar Guild.
planned_sessions.combat_encounter: The player will face off against a group of Xanathar Guild thieves in a crowded marketplace.
